9.00.text: These are the toughest economic times we've seen for generations.

12.50.text: Uncertainty about the future can make every day living difficult and stressful.

17.00.text: But we can help you beat the recession.

19.50.text: Westminster Council has introduced a range of measures,

22.50.text: to help you get where you want to be.

24.50.text: Financially secure, in a safe and warm home,

27.00.text: with the right job or training and

29.00.text: with access to great value activities.

38.00.text: Your council tax pays for over 250 vital services.

42.00.text: We appreciate that many household budgets are being stretched like never before,

46.00.text: so we've decided to freeze council tax until April 2010.

52.00.text: Our residents and also the businesses who employ our residents,

77.00.text: Because thats when the worst of the recession is going to be.

189.00.text: The first thing I'd say is don't just sit there

190.50.text: and think the problems is going to go away.

192.00.text: You need to do something about it.

194.00.text: So if you've got a mortgage, you should talk to your lender

197.00.text: and see what range of options they've got available to you

200.00.text: to maybe make your mortgage payments easier.

203.00.text: If you are having difficulty with your rent you need to speak to your landlord

206.00.text: and see if you can make an arrangement.

212.00.text: then give us a call at the Housing Options Service and we can help.
